intro: Galium azuayicum, commonly known as the Azuay bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Galium azuayicum is often found in high-altitude habitats and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native region.
